org.bubblecloud.zigbee.api

Class DeviceBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bubblecloud.zigbee.api.DeviceBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Device, ZigBeeEndpoint
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ColorDimmableLightDevice, DimmableLightDevice, GenericDevice, IAS_Warning_Device, IAS_ZoneDevice, IASAncillaryControlEquipmentDevice, IASControlAndIndicatingEquipmentDevice, LevelControlSwitchDevice, LightSensorDevice, MainsPowerOutletDevice, OccupancySensorDevice, OnOffLightDevice, OnOffLightSwitchDevice, OnOffOutputDevice, OnOffSwitchDevice, PumpDevice, SimpleSensorDevice, TemperatureSensorDevice, ThermostatControlDevice

    public abstract class DeviceBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements Device
    This class represent a generic Home Automation Device as defined by the document ZigBee Home Automation public release version 075123r01ZB

    NOTE: In general the mapping between ClusterId and Cluster is defined by the profile, while the mapping between Name and Cluster is defined where the Cluster is defined: usually inside a Cluster Library

    Since:
    0.1.0
    Version:
    $LastChangedRevision: 799 $ ($LastChangedDate: 2013-08-06 19:00:05 +0300 (Tue, 06 Aug 2013) $)
    Author:
    Stefano "Kismet" Lenzi, Francesco Furfari

      • isClusterValid

        protected boolean isClusterValid(int clusterId,
                     ProvidedClusterMode complainanceMode)

      • addCluster

        protected Cluster addCluster(int clusterId)
                      throws ZigBeeDeviceException
        This method create a cluster for the Device if and only if the cluster is actually supported by the device. Depending on the current value of cluster mode it add or not the cluster to the set of cluster which will be returned by executing the method getAvailableCluster()
        Parameters:
        clusterId - the id of the cluster
        Returns:
        Cluster if it is already present or if it has been added to the DeviceBase
        Throws:
        ZigBeeDeviceException

      • bindTo

        public boolean bindTo(Device device,
             int clusterId)
               throws ZigBeeNetworkManagerException
        This method modifies the Binding Table of physical device by adding the following entry: 
         this.getNode().getIeeeAddress(), this.getDeviceTypeId(), clusterId, device.getNode().getIeeeAddress(), device.getDeviceTypeId()
        Specified by:
        bindTo in interface Device
        Parameters:
        device - ZigBeeEndpoint the device proxy that we want to bound to
        clusterId - the clusterId that we want to bound to
        Returns:
        true if and only if the operation succeeded
        Throws:
        ZigBeeNetworkManagerException

      • invoke

        public ClusterMessage invoke(ClusterMessage input)
                      throws ZigBeeNetworkManagerException
        Invoke the given ClusterMessage (which is supposed to part of the Input Cluster) of this EndPoint,
        and wait for the a response from.
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface ZigBeeEndpoint
        Parameters:
        input - the ClusterMessage containing the id of the Cluster to invoke and the cluster message
        Returns:
        the ClusterMessage representing the response received after that the Cluster answer to
        the request.
        Throws:
        ZigBeeNetworkManagerException

      • send

        public void send(ClusterMessage input)
          throws ZigBeeNetworkManagerException
        Send the given ClusterMessage (which is supposed to be Input Cluster) to this EndPoint,
        on the contrary than the ZigBeeEndpoint.invoke(ClusterMessage) this method doesn't wait for nor requires
        an answer from the EndPoint-
        Specified by:
        send in interface ZigBeeEndpoint
        Parameters:
        input - the ClusterMessage containing the id of the Cluster to send to the cluster message
        Throws:
        ZigBeeNetworkManagerException

      • bindTo

             int clusterId)
               throws ZigBeeNetworkManagerException
        This method modify the Binding Table of physical endpoint by adding the following entry: 
         this.getNode().getIeeeAddress(), this.getDeviceTypeId(), clusterId, endpoint.getNode().getIeeeAddress(), endpoint.getDeviceTypeId()

        bindTo in interface ZigBeeEndpoint

        Returns:
        true if and only if the operation succeeded

        ZigBeeNetworkManagerException
